content.description: Four satellites <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> have circular orbits about Planets <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> and <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"> <mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi> </math>, as shown. Planet <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> has twice the mass of Planet <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. Satellite <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math> has mass <math alttext="lowercase m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and orbits a distance <math alttext="R" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> from the center of Planet <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. Satellites <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math> and <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math> have masses <math alttext="lowercase m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and <math alttext="2 lowercase m" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></math>, respectively, and orbit a distance <math alttext="2 R" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math> from the center of PlanetÂ <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>. Satellite <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math> has mass <math alttext="lowercase m" overflow="scroll"><mi>m</mi></math> and orbits Planet <math alttext="Y" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> in a distance <math alttext="2 R" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math> from the center of the Planet <math alttext="X" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math>.
content.question: Which of the following correctly ranks the orbital periods <math alttext="T sub A" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mtext mathvariant="italic">A</mtext></msub></math>, <math alttext="T sub B" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>B</mi></msub></math>, <math alttext="T sub C" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>C</mi></msub></math>, and <math alttext="T sub D" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>T</mi> <mi>D</mi> </msub> </math> of satellites <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi></math>, <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">B</mi></math>, <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi></math>, and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></math>, respectively, from least to greatest?

choices.label: <math alttext="T sub A is less than T sub D, which is less than, open parenthesis, T sub B equals T sub C, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo><</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>C</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="T sub A is less than, open parenthesis, T sub B equals T sub C, which equals T sub D, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>C</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="T sub D is less than T sub A, which is less than, open parenthesis, T sub B equals T sub C, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>C</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="T sub D is less than T sub A, which is less than, T sub B, which is less than T sub C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>C</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="T sub A is less than T sub D, which is less than, open parenthesis, T sub B equals T sub C, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>A</mi></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>D</mi></msub><mo><</mo><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>B</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mi>C</mi></msub><mo stretchy="false">)</mo></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
